Description: Ostracon, large section (two fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel with flaring sides, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is very damaged, although traces of a red-brown slip and seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393245) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393245)
Condition: fair (exteior very worn - two fragments joined)
